div.head: Authoritative Demarcation between Asseria and Sidrona

p.seg: This fragmentary boundary marker records an authoritative demarcationbetween Asseria (mod. Podgrađe near Benkovac in Croatia) and Sidrona (mod. Gradina at Medviđa).

div.p:
Though the name of the presiding official is lost, the settlement can be dated to (or near) the tenure of P. Cornelius Dolabella as governor of Dalmatia because the same centurion who handled the boundary demarcation between Corinium and Nedinum Instance
3 (Elliott 2004) . carried out similar duties in this instance. The surviving portion of the text is very similar to the more complete one from this other case, and it can be securely shown to have been a boundary restoration. Given this similarity and the coincidence of personnel, it is certainly possible that the present evidence also attests to such a restoration. This hypothesis cannot be proved without the discovery and publication of a complete marker, or the missing portion of this one.

div.ab:
---
[--] Caesaris Au(gusti) [---]
inter Sidrinos et
Asseriates Q(uintus) Aebu
tius Liberalis (centurio) leg(ionis)
XI definit

div.p: ... of Caesar Augustus ... between the Sidrini and the Asseriates, Quintus Aebutius Liberalis, centurion of Legio XI bounded it.
